Steam has came out with a new 'system' that you can submit, and rate other games! A Dev can submit Kerbal Space Program on Steam green light, and other people can rate it. If other people like it, it can be put onto Steam.

I don't know how the Steam systems works, so I don't know how KSP can be published on the Steam Store. So I hope this helped in some way. This new 'feature' came out not too long ago.

http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/showthread.php/19052-About-Greenlight

We are not using Greenlight, when I stated that it was at the time Valve was not taking applications for new games because they were working on Greenlight. But as Adrian has stated the game will eventually go on Steam, and currently, as far as I know, it will not be through Greenlight. Though it's come to our attention that people have posted KSP on Greenlight, these files will be removed as we do have communication with Valve. If it comes to light that anyone on these forums has posted KSP on Greenlight without permission, there will be punitive action taken against that person. The truth is, that while we very very much appreciate how much you all love the game, trying to add it to greenlight without the dev team's permission is actually going to cause more harm then good. So in short, please don't do it.

-DR

Though I'm certain a moderator will be around shortly to carry the same message, here's a heads up anyway:

http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/showthread.php/19052-About-Greenlight

Sorry, no, it won't help. There have already been a dozen or so threads posted about Greenlight, including one sticky in the developer's announcement forum, which I'm very surprised you couldn't find in a search to see if it's been mentioned.

Okay sorry, I seen Greenlight, and I thought it was a good idea for KSP. So I just posted this thread. I don't know why someone would post KSP that isn't a dev though. It says right there 'post your own game' clearly. But thanks for telling me that!
